There are 13 different species of otters around the world.
Sea otters have the densest fur of any mammal, with about 1 million hairs per square inch.
Otters use tools like rocks to break open shellfish.
Otters can stay underwater for up to 8 minutes.
Baby otters are called pups and are born blind.
Otters are known for their playful behavior and often slide down muddy banks.
River otters can swim up to 7 miles per hour.
Sea otters eat up to 25% of their body weight in food every day.
Otters have a special pouch where they store their favorite rock.
